intro: Armeria argyrocephala f. minor, commonly known as the silverhead thrift, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It features dense clusters of small, white to silver-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, branching stems covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered with a powdery coating. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils.
